commit_message:
Don't use du -x to calculate image size

du -x means only check the current file system. There is currently a bug
in overlayfs where files report to be on different filesystems and so
are not being counted by dib when building images within a docker
container.

It appears that the -x flag has been there since the beginning of this
file [1] and carried forward, however at this point in dib there should
not be anything mounted in the folder so hopefully not make a
difference.

There is a patch that should solve this issue [2] but who knows how long
it will take to land on builders.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25866/
[2] https://patchwork.kernel.org/patch/9706629/

Closes-Bug: #1702382
Change-Id: I563dbb84cfefaf7eabd2f1af5ba04be9648f7155

commit_message:
Disable SSH password authentication during tripleo-admin enablement.

SSH password authentication is now disabled when injecting the temporary
SSH key during the tripleo-admin user enablement. This change will cause
the SSH command to fail quickly if the key is rejected instead of appearing
to hang at a password prompt which is never displayed to the user.

Change-Id: I7b746b2033c217e78c3d9942995de1479a728943
Closes-Bug: #1792641
(cherry picked from commit 2535aca143b8eade668da3ba182ffeeb4de138f0)
(cherry picked from commit 74424dba322fd301b0f46ee0253d8650ecb31215)

commit_message:
Check for physical_resource_id before getting deployments

Heat does non-strict validation of nested stack resources.
Most constraints are not enforced for nested stack resources
It's possible to set {Role}DeploymentActions as something like
[''] and it would not fail in validation. This would result in
a deployment resource with no physical_resource_id. The existing
check[1] for config-download would not be sufficient for some
cases as it can be another nested stack (we alias
both OS::Tripleo::SoftwareDeployment and
OS::Heat::StructuredDeployment).

[1]
deployment.attributes['value'].get('deployment') == \
     'TripleOSoftwareDeployment'

This adds a new check not to try and download heat deployments with
no physical_resource_id.

Change-Id: I234e629cc5377cda8d5d01bfe4416ad967cdc067
Closes-Bug: #1812604
(cherry picked from commit 54c448f68354d48df49ca83a71932938e9c84810)

commit_message:
Add network data for the undercloud

The undercloud needs the External network for the external VIP
address. It uses the _from_pool template creating a fake neutron
port.

Other networks are not required, and should be removed to optimize
the number of heat resources and plan rendering.

NOTE: Skips validation of network_data_undercloud.yaml against
network_data.yaml, as is already done to openshift and routed
networks networks data examples.

Related Bug: #1809313
Change-Id: Ib11a134df93e59947168b40bc71fb1da9172d4ac

[{'created': '2018-12-13 20:57:38.000000000', 'message': 'Add TunedCustomProfile parameter and HCI Ceph filestore environment

Add TunedCustomProfile parameter which may contain a string in
INI format describing a custom tuned profile. Also provide a new
environment file for users of hypercoverged Ceph deployments
using the Ceph filestore storage backened. The tuned profile is
based on heavy I/O load testing. The provided environment file
creates /etc/tuned/ceph-filestore-osd-hci/tuned.conf whose

[sysfs]

commit_message:
Add TunedCustomProfile parameter and HCI Ceph filestore environment

Add TunedCustomProfile parameter which may contain a string in
INI format describing a custom tuned profile. Also provide a new
environment file for users of hypercoverged Ceph deployments
using the Ceph filestore storage backened. The tuned profile is
based on heavy I/O load testing. The provided environment file
creates /etc/tuned/ceph-filestore-osd-hci/tuned.conf whose
content is the following and sets this tuned profile to be active.

[main]
summary=ceph-osd Filestore tuned profile
include=throughput-performance
[sysctl]
vm.dirty_ratio = 10
vm.dirty_background_ratio = 3
[sysfs]
/sys/kernel/mm/ksm/run=0

Depends-On: Iba17d86bbdd710623ba1ba44b1ea5d4c1b99c541
Change-Id: Iaa1c82cefac5c8f2959fd7aeb57bd6860fd9096a
Closes-Bug: #1800232
(cherry picked from commit bc0246ff8a974f63229ed334b0c867472a3c9dc9)

commit_message:
Add TunedCustomProfile parameter and HCI Ceph filestore environment

Add TunedCustomProfile parameter which may contain a string in
INI format describing a custom tuned profile. Also provide a new
environment file for users of hypercoverged Ceph deployments
using the Ceph filestore storage backened. The tuned profile is
based on heavy I/O load testing. The provided environment file
creates /etc/tuned/ceph-filestore-osd-hci/tuned.conf whose
content is the following and sets this tuned profile to be active.

[main]
summary=ceph-osd Filestore tuned profile
include=throughput-performance
[sysctl]
vm.dirty_ratio = 10
vm.dirty_background_ratio = 3
[sysfs]
/sys/kernel/mm/ksm/run=0

Depends-On: Iba17d86bbdd710623ba1ba44b1ea5d4c1b99c541
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/628429
Change-Id: Iaa1c82cefac5c8f2959fd7aeb57bd6860fd9096a
Closes-Bug: #1800232
(cherry picked from commit bc0246ff8a974f63229ed334b0c867472a3c9dc9)

Without these changes, I'm currently seeing:

  python-novaclient 11.1.0 has requirement PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2, but you'll have prettytable 0.7.1 which is incompatible.
  python-magnumclient 2.11.0 has requirement PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2, but you'll have prettytable 0.7.1 which is incompatible.
  python-watcherclient 2.2.0 has requirement oslo.i18n>=3.20.0, but you'll have oslo-i18n 3.19.0 which is incompatible.
  python-watcherclient 2.2.0 has requirement oslo.utils>=3.36.0, but you'll have oslo-utils 3.35.0 which is incompatible.
  python-watcherclient 2.2.0 has requirement PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2, but you'll have prettytable 0.7.1 which is incompatible.
  kubernetes 8.0.1 has requirement urllib3>=1.23, but you'll have urllib3 1.22 which is incompatible.
  python-monascaclient 1.12.1 has requirement PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2, but you'll have prettytable 0.7.1 which is incompatible.
  python-heatclient 1.17.0 has requirement PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2, but you'll have prettytable 0.7.1 which is incompatible.
  python-troveclient 2.17.0 has requirement PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2, but you'll have prettytable 0.7.1 which is incompatible.
  python-muranoclient 1.1.1 has requirement PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2, but you'll have prettytable 0.7.1 which is incompatible.
  python-senlinclient 1.9.0 has requirement PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2, but you'll have prettytable 0.7.1 which is incompatible.
  cliff 2.14.0 has requirement PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2, but you'll have prettytable 0.7.1 which is incompatible.

when installing rally-openstack with pip:

  pip install .

and this is what I see when I try and run rally:

  (venv-rally) [will@dev-director rally-openstack]$ rally deployment create --fromenv --name existing
  2019-01-17 14:10:09.005 21837 WARNING rally.common.plugin.discover [-] 	 Failed to load plugins from module 'rally_openstack' (package: 'rally-openstack 1.3.1.dev70'): (prettytable 0.7.1 (/home/will/venv-rally/lib/python2.7/site-packages), Requirement.parse('PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2'), set(['python-novaclient', 'python-magnumclient', 'python-watcherclient', 'python-monascaclient', 'python-heatclient', 'python-troveclient', 'python-muranoclient', 'python-senlinclient', 'osprofiler'])): ContextualVersionConflict: (prettytable 0.7.1 (/home/will/venv-rally/lib/python2.7/site-packages), Requirement.parse('PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2'), set(['python-novaclient', 'python-magnumclient', 'python-watcherclient', 'python-monascaclient', 'python-heatclient', 'python-troveclient', 'python-muranoclient', 'python-senlinclient', 'osprofiler']))

some of these errors are coming from constraints in rally itself, please
see the `Depends-On` link.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/631524

commit_message:
Bump upper constraints to fix conflicts

Without these changes, I'm currently seeing:

  python-novaclient 11.1.0 has requirement PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2, but you'll have prettytable 0.7.1 which is incompatible.
  python-magnumclient 2.11.0 has requirement PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2, but you'll have prettytable 0.7.1 which is incompatible.
  python-watcherclient 2.2.0 has requirement oslo.i18n>=3.20.0, but you'll have oslo-i18n 3.19.0 which is incompatible.
  python-watcherclient 2.2.0 has requirement oslo.utils>=3.36.0, but you'll have oslo-utils 3.35.0 which is incompatible.
  python-watcherclient 2.2.0 has requirement PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2, but you'll have prettytable 0.7.1 which is incompatible.
  kubernetes 8.0.1 has requirement urllib3>=1.23, but you'll have urllib3 1.22 which is incompatible.
  python-monascaclient 1.12.1 has requirement PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2, but you'll have prettytable 0.7.1 which is incompatible.
  python-heatclient 1.17.0 has requirement PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2, but you'll have prettytable 0.7.1 which is incompatible.
  python-troveclient 2.17.0 has requirement PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2, but you'll have prettytable 0.7.1 which is incompatible.
  python-muranoclient 1.1.1 has requirement PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2, but you'll have prettytable 0.7.1 which is incompatible.
  python-senlinclient 1.9.0 has requirement PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2, but you'll have prettytable 0.7.1 which is incompatible.
  cliff 2.14.0 has requirement PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2, but you'll have prettytable 0.7.1 which is incompatible.
  osprofiler 2.5.2 has requirement PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2, but you'll have prettytable 0.7.1 which is incompatible.
  python-watcherclient 2.2.0 has requirement oslo.i18n>=3.20.0, but you'll have oslo-i18n 3.19.0 which is incompatible.
  python-watcherclient 2.2.0 has requirement oslo.utils>=3.36.0, but you'll have oslo-utils 3.35.0 which is incompatible.
  kubernetes 8.0.1 has requirement urllib3>=1.23, but you'll have urllib3 1.22 which is incompatible.
  requests 2.19.1 has requirement urllib3<1.24,>=1.21.1, but you'll have urllib3 1.24 which is incompatible.

when installing rally-openstack with pip:

  pip install .

and this is what I see when I try and run rally:

  (venv-rally) [will@dev-director rally-openstack]$ rally deployment create --fromenv --name existing
  2019-01-17 14:10:09.005 21837 WARNING rally.common.plugin.discover [-] 	 Failed to load plugins from module 'rally_openstack' (package: 'rally-openstack 1.3.1.dev70'): (prettytable 0.7.1 (/home/will/venv-rally/lib/python2.7/site-packages), Requirement.parse('PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2'), set(['python-novaclient', 'python-magnumclient', 'python-watcherclient', 'python-monascaclient', 'python-heatclient', 'python-troveclient', 'python-muranoclient', 'python-senlinclient', 'osprofiler'])): ContextualVersionConflict: (prettytable 0.7.1 (/home/will/venv-rally/lib/python2.7/site-packages), Requirement.parse('PrettyTable<0.8,>=0.7.2'), set(['python-novaclient', 'python-magnumclient', 'python-watcherclient', 'python-monascaclient', 'python-heatclient', 'python-troveclient', 'python-muranoclient', 'python-senlinclient', 'osprofiler']))

some of these errors are coming from constraints in rally itself, please
see the `Depends-On` link.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/631524
Change-Id: I6b46a17535d0b8fe70411c6052c0d874d6b0dae4

commit_message:
Explicitly manage http configs

Previously the kolla config is merging the existing apache configuration
files in the container with our generated ones. This can lead to extra
configurations in the containers that we are not expecting. This change
updates the kolla configs to not merge the httpd conf.d folder so we only
end up with our expected configurations.

Change-Id: Ibb9bbeb12e73b2cf8887554f461873e42532edd7
Related-Bug: 1813084

> Agreed about notifying operators. Keep in mind, of course, that
 > we're not proposing getting rid of per-compute allocation ratios.
 > Just proposing having the CONF options on the nova-compute...

Yeah, I see in the latest version here you say compute will never overwrite them itself, so I guess an operator could just set it per-compute in placement directly.

However, as has been pointed out multiple times, giving config management credentials because they have to do things via the API is not favored by all people, so I imagine people who want per-compute-in-config as an option would be the same group not thrilled about doing it per-compute-in-placement.

It seems odd since we were previously asked to "make everything happen through the API always" to the point of nearly freezing nova-manage, but alas the pendulum swings forth and the pendulum swings back.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-02-20 13:16:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 20:20:30.000000000', 'message': 'Account for host agg allocation ratio in placement

In order to facilitate operators that use the
Aggregate[Cpu|Ram|Disk]Filter scheduler filters and the associated nova
host aggregate metadata keys for allocation ratios -- instead of setting
the nova-compute configuration options for those allocation ratios, we
propose to have the nova-compute check to see if the compute host is in
an aggregate that contains allocation ratio metadata keys before setting
its allocation ratios to the "defaults".

Change-Id: I690eea052a606186b182b3b490d91fd704443ffe
blueprint: placement-aggregate-allocation-ratios
'}, {'created': '2018-02-15 19:40:56.000000000', 'message': 'Account for host agg allocation ratio in placement

commit_message:
Functional: Do not install postgres by default

It shouldn't be needed and it just slow downs the tests setup.

This patch also removes the ./tools/* directory from the
"irrelevant-files" from the legacy base class, otherwise the functional
tests wouldn't run as a consequency of the changes in this patch.

Change-Id: I198f84455b092d4b401bd2f61f158741c00e2ab1
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Allow user to define a custom tuned profile

Add custom_profile parameter to tripleo::profile::base::tuned
which may a string in INI format describing a tuned profile
which puppet will then create and apply with the name supplied
by the profile parameter.

Change-Id: Iba17d86bbdd710623ba1ba44b1ea5d4c1b99c541
Related-Bug: #1800232
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/628434
(cherry picked from commit 3c953e877b74f2c4d93e57d3b093d9171e897e72)

[{'created': '2019-01-24 16:02:40.000000000', 'message': "[Queens only] Include new parameter RHELRegistrationUpgrade to rhel-registration.

Setting the rhel_reg_force parameter to true during upgrade prepare
doesn't work correctly when the customer passes the rhel-registration/
environment-rhel-registration.yaml, as this template sets an empty
value for that parameter by default (an which is usually not modified
by the user). As environments/lifecycle/upgrade-prepare.yaml is prepended,
any template setting a different value for rhel_reg_force param will have
precedence on what we set in the upgade-prepare.yaml env file.

The solution is creating a new parameter RHELRegistrationUpgrade, which
defaults to false and which we ensure it's set to true during upgrade
prepare by setting it in environments/lifecycle/upgrade-prepare.yaml.
When RHELRegistrationUpgrade is set to True we enforce that REG_FORCE
sets to True, otherwise it will simply take the value passed in the heat
parameter rhel_reg_force.

Closes-Bug: #1813184

Change-Id: Idc1bdad0a19150569dacb88abd539d86741bc643
"}, {'created': '2019-01-24 16:04:59.000000000', 'message': "[Queens only] Include new parameter RHELRegistrationUpgrade to rhel-registration.

Setting the rhel_reg_force parameter to true during upgrade prepare
doesn't work correctly when the customer passes the rhel-registration/
environment-rhel-registration.yaml, as this template sets an empty
value for that parameter by default (an which is usually not modified
by the user). As environments/lifecycle/upgrade-prepare.yaml is prepended,
any template setting a different value for rhel_reg_force param will have
precedence on what we set in the upgade-prepare.yaml env file.

The solution is creating a new parameter RHELRegistrationUpgrade, which
defaults to false and which we ensure it's set to true during upgrade
prepare by setting it in environments/lifecycle/upgrade-prepare.yaml.
When RHELRegistrationUpgrade is set to True we enforce that REG_FORCE
sets to True, otherwise it will simply take the value passed in the heat
parameter rhel_reg_force.

Closes-Bug: #1813184

Change-Id: Idc1bdad0a19150569dacb88abd539d86741bc643
"}]
commit_message:
[Queens only] Include new parameter RHELRegistrationUpgrade to rhel-registration.

Setting the rhel_reg_force parameter to true during upgrade prepare
doesn't work correctly when the customer passes the rhel-registration/
environment-rhel-registration.yaml, as this template sets an empty
value for that parameter by default (an which is usually not modified
by the user). As environments/lifecycle/upgrade-prepare.yaml is prepended,
any template setting a different value for rhel_reg_force param will have
precedence on what we set in the upgade-prepare.yaml env file.

The solution is creating a new parameter RHELRegistrationUpgrade, which
defaults to false and which we ensure it's set to true during upgrade
prepare by setting it in environments/lifecycle/upgrade-prepare.yaml.
When RHELRegistrationUpgrade is set to True we enforce that REG_FORCE
sets to True, otherwise it will simply take the value passed in the heat
parameter rhel_reg_force.

Closes-Bug: #1813184

Change-Id: Idc1bdad0a19150569dacb88abd539d86741bc643

[{'created': '2019-01-17 12:58:17.000000000', 'message': "WIP - haproxy: deploy IPtables rules from the host

Calling iptables CLI in the container requires advanced and risky
bind-mounts, and on certain platform, iptables-save can't be found (e.g.
fedora28 containers).

This patch simplifies the firewall step for HAproxy container
configuration where we now run Puppet on the host instead of from the
container.

TODO:

- pacemaker/haproxy
- eventually refactor the puppet command into a script?

commit_message:
haproxy: deploy IPtables rules from the host

Calling iptables CLI in the container requires advanced and risky
bind-mounts, and on certain platform, iptables-save can't be found (e.g.
fedora28 containers).

This patch simplifies the firewall step for HAproxy container
configuration where we now run Puppet on the host instead of from the
container.

Note: we can't use the puppet module in Ansible yet because we need
Ansible 2.7.6 which has:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/commit/8606fb33f0e8954b588eaecec2d99b4a120fd4ad
In the meantime, we use shell.


Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Cédric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ia66db8e4ab0ccec7cc86665e2ad32d2861fe30c8

commit_message:
Revert "Make Fedora 28 mixed standalone job voting"

This reverts commit b58c6643eeee931eeafe696d7a88f553d6428336.

This job is failing a bunch. I'm not sure why we even switched
it to voting.

Related-Bug: #1813224
Change-Id: I960f08a201492d996cc0d3bfe6158ad46416b97e

subject: Mount in yum_update.sh when running it
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-24 00:16:42.000000000', 'message': 'Mount in yum_update.sh when running it

Rather than copy the ephemeral script yum_update.sh, just mount it in
during the buildah run call which runs it.

This results in one less layer, and may work around an issue seen in
the gate where the file is sometimes not in the image when expected.

Change-Id: I1303be08ed162318f4b4b8f3aabf873c13ae9b99
'}]
commit_message:
Mount in yum_update.sh when running it

Rather than copy the ephemeral script yum_update.sh, just mount it in
during the buildah run call which runs it.

This results in one less layer, and may work around an issue seen in
the gate where the file is sometimes not in the image when expected.

Change-Id: I1303be08ed162318f4b4b8f3aabf873c13ae9b99

commit_message:
Remove crane image from prepare list

The crane component is being dropped by the Pulp project, it won't be
ported to python 3 and it has just been removed from Fedora.

This change removes the crane image. The replacement for
docker-distribution will be apache running directly on the undercloud
host.

Change-Id: I3abbce67147561fad00e3e1f22fbbe4dc1d21b54
Blueprint: podman-support

commit_message:
Add tests for project users interacting with sps

This commit introduces some tests that show how project users
are expected to behave with the federated service provider API.
A subsequent patch will clean up the now obsolete policies in the
policy.v3cloudsample.json file.

Change-Id: I799fedbb250614fef7ce0a55bd4ac266475ad3a1
Related-Bug: 1804520

commit_message:
Add tests for domain users interacting with sps

This commit introduces some tests that show how domain users are
expected to behave with the federated service provider API. A
subsequent patch will do the same for project users.

Change-Id: I27f7550d4f05494d19cbbf67e2e1a7fdfc19b21a
Related-Bug: 1804520

commit_message:
Update service provider  policies for system admin

This change makes the policy definitions for admin service
provider operations consistent with the other service provider
policies. Subsequent patches will incorporate:

 - domain users test coverage
 - project users test coverage

Change-Id: I621192f089d1b29e2585d0030716348274e50bf1
Related-Bug: 1804520
Closes-Bug: 1804522

subject: overcloud: remove libvirt and os-collect-config

re libvirt - we require libvirt-guests / libvirt-libs packages for NovaResumeGuestsStateOnHostBoot . If we want to remove libvirt packages  per default, we could install them if someone wants to use NovaResumeGuestsStateOnHostBoot in the host prep task.

https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/puppet/services/nova-compute.yaml#L381'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-01-25 13:30:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Excellent feedback Martin, I'll patch THT."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-01-25 16:21:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-23 20:09:21.000000000', 'message': "overcloud: remove libvirt and os-collect-config

- os-collect-config shouldn't be used anymore, since we have
  config-download taking care of configuring nodes via Ansible.
- libvirt is running in the containers, we shouldn't need the rpm
  installed on the host.

Change-Id: Idb58f59886175d7d384b031cc61dcf99363558c1
"}]
commit_message:
overcloud: remove libvirt and os-collect-config

- os-collect-config shouldn't be used anymore, since we have
  config-download taking care of configuring nodes via Ansible.
- libvirt is running in the containers, we shouldn't need the rpm
  installed on the host.

Change-Id: Idb58f59886175d7d384b031cc61dcf99363558c1

[{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-22 22:56:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6062, 'date': '2018-10-23 07:05:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-26 13:43:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(5 comments)

Concise spec with clear use case. The main concern here is the image metadata property. Do we _really_ need that? More inline'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-26 16:09:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-26 17:24:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

Seems we do need that image metadata spec so let's do this."}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-10-29 08:21:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

A question inline'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-29 14:01:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-29 14:02:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-10-30 02:03:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 3031, 'date': '2018-11-21 00:05:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

LGTM it makes sense that this would be the default if it was backwards compatible?'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-21 14:05:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> LGTM it makes sense that this would be the default if it was backwards compatible?

It's not really backward compatible in all cases, e.g. if you rebuild a server after this change and we defaulted to assuming per-instance serial number, the serial would change from whatever was on the host to the instance.uuid."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-21 14:07:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> LGTM it makes sense that this would be the default if it was backwards compatible?

It might be worth thinking about adding another option to the [libvirt]/sysinfo_serial config option to use per-instance serial numbers in the case that an operator wants to make the change globally via nova.conf rather than put it into all of their flavors/images. I feel like we've already talked about that, but I'm not sure why it wouldn't be in the spec."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-21 14:08:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Oh I guess it is the first alternative, and I sided against that since then it's still per-host configuration rather than per-instance with the flavor and image. But an argument could probably be made that if it were configurable in nova-compute, a deployment might decide to just set it that way globally."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-21 14:09:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-12-07 01:33:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

POC code up for review:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619953/'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-18 17:50:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-12-18 18:58:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(4 comments)

some comments inline but ya im largely happy with the spec as written so +1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-18 21:33:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-12-18 22:03:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-03 21:15:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So to be clear, I think the open question on this is if the alternative (adding a new choice to the existing [libvirt]/sys_info_serial option) should also be part of the spec, so not an alternative, but part of the proposed change, so you could have per-instance serials either via config or image or flavor for maximum flexibility. Is that accurate?'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-01-03 22:01:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

yes

should we do both and support

config flavor and image metadata for most flexibility or leave the config value as an alternative and proceed as currently written.

i don't have a strong feeling either way but i have a slight preference for supporting all 3 methods of enabling the new behavior."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-01-04 08:33:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

On whether or not we should support config, flavor, and image as ways to specify per-instance serial numbers, I think it sounds like enabling it via config would make life a lot easier if it is the operator who is providing the licensed software, rather than the tenant. That way they don't have to set it in potentially a lot of flavors/images and instead set it in config. I see we already have a lot of choices for the sysinfo_serial option and adding an 'instance' choice looks like it would fit in well (is along the same lines of the existing pattern)."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-04 19:35:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

(1 comment)

> On whether or not we should support config, flavor, and image as ways to specify per-instance serial numbers, I think it sounds like enabling it via config would make life a lot easier if it is the operator who is providing the licensed software, rather than the tenant. That way they don't have to set it in potentially a lot of flavors/images and instead set it in config. I see we already have a lot of choices for the sysinfo_serial option and adding an 'instance' choice looks like it would fit in well (is along the same lines of the existing pattern).

Yeah I'll update this to add a new choice to the existing option."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-04 21:17:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-01-04 21:32:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

LGTM, looks like a good, simple way to solve the use case of per installation software licenses and instance migrations.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-01-07 10:48:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2019-01-07 14:57:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

(2 comments)

LGTM, that's a simple spec. I just wonder if it's only a libvirt spec, or something other virt drivers could use."}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2019-01-09 08:30:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-01-10 05:41:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(2 comments)

Few comments, one is for the detail of the contract of this extra spec and image metadata. Another one is to remind we should document clearly change the config option will break the software license also. Those can be refined in the implement, so it isn't worth a blocking."}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2019-01-11 01:31:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-14 15:54:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Spec for blueprint per-instance-libvirt-sysinfo-serial

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-20 01:27:00.000000000', 'message': 'Add Policy Based Routing Support to os-net-config

Add support for routing tables and rules, as well as a
property to specify a routing table for each route to
the impl_ifcfg implementation.

This change adds a new top-level object in the
network_config with type "route_table" to specify
which route table IDs and names should be added to
the /etc/iproute2/rt_table file.

This change adds a "table" property to routes for each
interface type, that allows the selection of which
routing table to apply the route to.

This change also adds a "rules" property to each
interface type, which can be used to specify a list
of rules. Each rule contains a rule string and an
optional comment, both of which will be added to the
/etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/rule-<iface> file.

This change includes tests and changes to the schema
for validation.

Note that this change was based on the abandoned patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575712
and was recreated when that patch diverged too far
from master branch.

Change-Id: I6906d3b6923845af177faba6579fa255a2195bec
Closes-bug: #1783297
'}, {'created': '2019-01-22 10:53:31.000000000', 'message': 'Add Policy Based Routing Support to os-net-config

network_config with type "route_table" to specify
which route table IDs and names should be added to
the /etc/iproute2/rt_table file.

interface type, that allows the selection of which
routing table to apply the route to.

This change also adds a "rules" property to each
interface type, which can be used to specify a list
of rules. Each rule contains a rule string and an
optional comment, both of which will be added to the
/etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/rule-<iface> file.

This change includes tests and changes to the schema
for validation.

Note that this change was based on the abandoned patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575712

from master branch.

commit_message:
Add Policy Based Routing Support to os-net-config

Add support for routing tables and rules, as well as a
property to specify a routing table for each route to
the impl_ifcfg implementation.

This change adds a new top-level object in the
network_config with type "route_table" to specify
which route table IDs and names should be added to
the /etc/iproute2/rt_table file.

This change adds a "table" property to routes for each
interface type, that allows the selection of which
routing table to apply the route to.

This change also adds a "rules" property to each
interface type, which can be used to specify a list
of rules. Each rule contains a rule string and an
optional comment, both of which will be added to the
/etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/rule-<iface> file.

This change includes tests and changes to the schema
for validation.

Note that this change was based on the abandoned patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575712
and was recreated when that patch diverged too far
from master branch.

Change-Id: I6906d3b6923845af177faba6579fa255a2195bec
Closes-bug: #1783297

commit_message:
Support the latest alembic

The action of removing action is included in migration list while
removing the table.

https://github.com/zzzeek/alembic/blob/master/docs/build/changelog.rst
.. change::
        :tags: bug, autogenerate
        :tickets: 468

        Fixed bug where the indexes would not be included in a
        migration that was dropping the owning table.   The fix
        now will also emit DROP INDEX for the indexes ahead of time,
        but more importantly will include CREATE INDEX in the
        downgrade migration.

Change-Id: If5332876eb40a433450de52d69bea727a9d4fceb

commit_message:
Report msg error when cannot revert to snapshot

This patch fix bug: when revert volume to snapshot which status
is not available, the report msg error, '%s' should be behind
snapshot not volume.

Change-Id: Ia449f3619837f2050ddfbbbf006451d1aba5014a

Also send broker-timestamp to storage units when providing
rings_url so that we have a means of knowing which is the most
recent. Broker timestamp is the same for peer and storage

commit_message:
Cleanup ring manager storage relation settings

If local unit is no longer leader, clear rings_url on
storage relations to avoid storage units getting
rings from wrong proxy unit.

Also send broker-timestamp to storage units when providing
rings_url so that we have a means of knowing which is the most
recent. Broker timestamp is the same for peer and storage
sync so this enables identifying most recent.

Change-Id: I2c7e9028f345791bad0a736cb89979284b144e33
Closes-Bug: #1765203
(cherry picked from commit f25d2c2d7f721cc12e04c63e1a180eeda2d64a7b)

[{'created': '2019-01-25 00:38:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix version comparison for SLE12

The version comparison introduced in
I5152f2585c3d4d18853988d6290039d6b1713b99 was broken, because it tried
to use bash's -lt operator for floating point comparison, but bash
only supports integer arithmetic.

So instead use devstack's vercmp() function.

Change-Id: I8aac71c5bb6c2e82479d62831ea0672ba6a9a534
"}, {'created': '2019-01-25 01:06:56.000000000', 'message': "Fix version comparison for SUSE Linux Enterprise 12

The version comparison introduced in
I5152f2585c3d4d18853988d6290039d6b1713b99 was broken, because it tried
to use bash's -lt operator for floating point comparison, but bash
only supports integer arithmetic.

So instead use devstack's vercmp() function.

Change-Id: I8aac71c5bb6c2e82479d62831ea0672ba6a9a534
"}]
commit_message:
Fix version comparison for SUSE Linux Enterprise 12

The version comparison introduced in
I5152f2585c3d4d18853988d6290039d6b1713b99 was broken, because it tried
to use bash's -lt operator for floating point comparison, but bash
only supports integer arithmetic.

So instead use devstack's vercmp() function.

Change-Id: I8aac71c5bb6c2e82479d62831ea0672ba6a9a534

commit_message:
Allow prometheus-openstack-exporter to access keystone

To get openstack related metrics, prometheus-openstack-exporter need to
access to keystone. So add prometheus-openstack-exporter to network
policy of keystone.

Change-Id: I31106a10e512578a35122949c3cff698b1bc482b
Signed-off-by: Deokjin Kim <deokjin81.kim@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Ensure we get a clean firewall

The iptables-services package pushes a bunch of default rules, activated as soon
as we start the "iptables" systemd unit.

This patch intends to remove those default rules, in order to ensure we get
only managed firewall rules (either by puppet, or by any openstack service like
neutron).

In order to prevent any issue, instead of erasing the file, we actually save the
current state prior the iptables-services installation and subsequent service startup.

The iptables-services installation and activation is done at the "include ::firewall"
step.
Prior that, iptables is empty, meaning if we save, and pre-create the
/etc/sysconfig/iptables and /etc/sysconfig/ip6tables files before we include the
"::firewall" class, we will get an empty, clean ruleset.

Please note, this won't correct already deployed infrastructure though - that will
probably requires an upgrade_tasks directly in tripleo-heat-templates.

SecurityImpact
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1667887
Partial-Bug: #1812695
Change-Id: I74d15b8de216984ac42a0839430ae9afe2554d16

(1 comment)

Trying to publish again.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-01-25 15:14:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This published the new qcow under both its expected path name and with its enduring git-tagged name.  It left the old tagged qcows in place.

However it did not clean out the old images/images garbage subdirectory.

This may be because there are really two stages at work here.

First there is the sync controlled by the playbook under our control:

2019-01-25 14:59:53.275217 | PLAY [Copy artifacts]

2019-01-25 14:59:53.342127 | 

2019-01-25 14:59:53.342351 | TASK [Ensure artifacts directory exists]

2019-01-25 14:59:53.992947 | ubuntu-xenial -> localhost | changed

2019-01-25 14:59:54.061974 | 

2019-01-25 14:59:54.062370 | TASK [Collect artifacts]

2019-01-25 15:00:30.152179 | ubuntu-xenial | changed:

2019-01-25 15:00:30.152725 | ubuntu-xenial | cd+++++++++ ./

2019-01-25 15:00:30.152839 | ubuntu-xenial | >f+++++++++ manila-service-image-1.3.0-37-ge06b752.qcow2

2019-01-25 15:00:30.152946 | ubuntu-xenial | >f+++++++++ manila-service-image-master.qcow2

Then later publish-artifacts-to-fileserver runs:

2019-01-25 15:00:42.151176 | TASK [publish-artifacts-to-fileserver : Ensure project artifact directory exists]

2019-01-25 15:00:44.000517 | tarballs.openstack.org | changed

2019-01-25 15:00:44.177369 | 

2019-01-25 15:00:44.177622 | TASK [publish-artifacts-to-fileserver : Upload contents of the artifacts folder]

2019-01-25 15:01:40.114081 | tarballs.openstack.org | changed:

2019-01-25 15:01:40.114625 | tarballs.openstack.org | .d..tp..... ./

2019-01-25 15:01:40.114738 | tarballs.openstack.org | .d..tp..... images/

2019-01-25 15:01:40.114844 | tarballs.openstack.org | <f+++++++++ images/manila-service-image-1.3.0-37-ge06b752.qcow2

2019-01-25 15:01:40.114946 | tarballs.openstack.org | <f.stp..... images/manila-service-image-master.qcow2

And in that play different rsync options are used so that the cleanup isn't done."}]

commit_message:
Ensure artifacts directory exists

When we merged https://review.openstack.org/#/c/631846/ the
new image failed to upload to tarballs.openstack.org and the
error message in the post job indicated that the artifacts
directory was missing.

Change-Id: If1068b410e646f780635d733b52172d93da78db5

About how this work relates to the existing charms:
This is a addition to make it easier for individual contributors to write new cinder subordinate charms that relate to the existing Cinder charms to provide support for deploying OpenStack with third party vendor specific storage solutions. commit_message:
Create repository for ceilometer-dashboard plugin

Grafana can be used to display data from Ceilometer. This Horizon plugin can
manage structures in Grafana (via API) for Horizon users as they can directly
look on graphs without need to authenticate against Grafana UI.

Depends-On: I2f886a57c6d54702f96330231c51f6d735c4c069
Change-Id: I65de712b1bd21faa6b5e3c095689ac0ac9e8d5c9

commit_message:
Update base-test jobs to publish artifacts too

If the job succeeded and doesn't have a zuul.change, it means it's
operating on landed code. That means anything on the executor in the
artifacts directory should be published to tarballs.o.o/{project}.

Change-Id: Ia6add476b7b1933353f1bc4736ff07ff1083857b

commit_message:
monasca-persister: Add default config file

Use oslo-config-generator to generate the persister.conf file . This
was missing in the package.

Change-Id: I7025f81c5110ac67f1b4a3c217dda9a4a62d2d77

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/613613/4 : SUCCESS in 2h 13m 12s'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-30 12:56:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

I whined at Eric about this quite a bit end of last week [1], that safe connect evolved to have a purpose that it fails to fulfil, so while removing it in broken situations doesn't further break things, there are still things we need to be safe about (see the link for more).

But for now, this is fine, as it removes an error that hides the real error.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2018-10-26.log.html#t2018-10-26T15:24:47"}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-12-05 21:42:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

I'd like to see safe_connect removed entirely, but this is a reasonable solution to the error at hand."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-12-05 22:01:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> I'd like to see safe_connect removed entirely,

Totally. At some point (in a cluster of patches I'm too lazy to go and find right now) we discussed various strategies for making that happen. We decided that there was no good, clean way to get rid of it in one fell swoop. And given that, we decided on a strategy of removing the decorator from one method at a time (like what's done in this patch) until they're all gone."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2019-01-15 18:06:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

I'd like to merge the surge of purge of safe_connect."}, {'account_id': 6062, 'date': '2019-01-16 09:41:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-01-25 01:42:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Kill @safe_connect in _get_provider_traits

I heed the urge to surge forth and purge the scourge of @safe_connect.

This was motivated by actually having hit a placement comm error in the
PowerVM CI, resulting in:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 7690, in _update_available_resource_for_node

  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/retrying.py", line 247, in get

  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/retrying.py", line 200, in call
    attempt = Attempt(fn(*args, **kwargs), attempt_number, False)
  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py", line 990, in _update
    self._update_to_placement(context, compute_node, startup)
  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py", line 976, in _update_to_placement
    compute_node)
  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/scheduler/client/__init__.py", line 72, in update_compute_node
    self.reportclient.update_compute_node(context, compute_node)
  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/scheduler/client/__init__.py", line 37, in __run_method
    return getattr(self.instance, __name)(*args, **kwargs)

    compute_node.hypervisor_hostname)

commit_message:
Use OpenStack HA charmhelper for ha configuration

Use the new OpenStack HA charmhelper to generate required data
to pass to the hacluster charm when running in clustered
deployments.

This also makes the switch to iface-less configuration of VIP
resources resolving issues in deployments where LXD containers
don't have consistent interface ordering across the application.

Change-Id: Ie0ca7fb0221cb6c3f886161e1b446d4fae5775a9

commit_message:
Fix typos and translation builds

We sometimes received random non-throughout typo fixes,
so it would be helpful to check typos throughoutly.

Co-Authored-By: Frank Kloeker <f.kloeker@telekom.de>

Change-Id: Ib4727ea7e48b3c6153b01b2a5572efcb3f054a4e

(1 comment)

I assume this is going to be an operator-only activity?

Otherwise the fact that it has to happen within the same cell will lead to people playing whack-a-mole trying to find a host that's in the same cell since that information isn't supposed to be visible to end users.

Even if it is operator/admin-only, how does someone choose a target host?"}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2017-06-01 07:52:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 47:

@Chris, the cold migrate action is administrator only operation by default.
And administrators can get cell and hosts mapping by the following command.

* nova-manage cell_v2 discover_hosts --verbose
* nova-manage cell_v2 map_cell_and_hosts --verbose'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2017-06-04 23:54:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 48: Patch Set 47 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 20040, 'date': '2017-06-05 01:21:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 48:

commit_message:
Enable cold migration with target host(1/2)

This function enables users to specify a target host
when cold migrating a VM instance.

By default, only admin users may perform
a cold migration operation.
This patch does not change that policy default.

This patch modifies a compute API and conductor.
A subsequent patch modifies the migration API.

Change-Id: I57568e9a01664ee373ea00a8db3164109c982909
Implements: blueprint cold-migration-with-target-queens

commit_message:
Add wait for resource cleanup if there is no parent

When using cleanup_resource in base_client it now waits
for actual cleanup of the resource if there is no parent
resource. This is to prevent cleanup of resources that
are still in use by the resource that is being deleted.

Change-Id: Idcad34a085d6f346ef225386bb3cdcd450cd4db7
Story: 2004835
Task: 29029

commit_message:
Add support for VLAN type networks in networking-ovn

This patch is adding support for VLAN type networks in networking-ovn by
setting the new "reside-on-redirect-chassis" option in the
Logical_Router_Port table for router interfaces that are attached to a
VLAN network.

This option causes the routing for the router interface to be
centralized in the chassis hosting the distributed gateway port. For
more information check the commit message from the OVN core patch at
https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/85706c34d53d4810f54bec1de662392a3c06a996

As a note, since VLAN wasn't supported before this patch is not offering
any migration for existing router interfaces that were created prior to
this patch.

Change-Id: I419ea318c8d78726b5263eecbb1f70bb34f7d96d
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2018-12-05 16:31:15.000000000', 'message': 'Add "irrelevant-files" to rally job

This patch is adding the "irrelevant-files" section to the rally job
definition. This would prevent the rally job from running on patches
that which *only* changes files that are irrelevant to it. An example of
patch can be find here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/622242/

This patch also moves the rally job definition to the
zuul.d/networkin-ovn-jobs.yaml file which consolidates all the Zuul
native jobs at the moment.

commit_message:
Add "irrelevant-files" section to the rally job definition

This patch is adding the "irrelevant-files" section to the rally job
definition. This would prevent the rally job from running on patches
that which *only* changes files that are irrelevant to it. An example of
patch can be find here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/622242/

This patch also moves the rally job definition to the
zuul.d/networkin-ovn-jobs.yaml file which consolidates all the Zuul
native jobs at the moment.

Change-Id: I7c0df52e2a49d0aa5164b3f06360788b0f67e293
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-21 13:30:21.000000000', 'message': "Switch to AZAwareWeightScheduler as of Mitaka

AZAwareWeightScheduler is based on WeightScheduler and provides a way to make
DHCP agent scheduling be AZ-aware. This is used in conjunction with
dhcp-agents-per-network config option and per-network agents (such as dnsmasq)
will be distributed across neutron-dhcp-agents that have availability_zone
configuration (based on dhcp-load-type for placement calculation).

bp: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/add-availability-zone

Upgrade impact is mentioned here:
specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/mitaka/availability-zone.html

The spec mentions that by default all agents belong to 'nova' AZ so
the scheduler change should be backwards-compatible.

Change-Id: I4d948efa157573fdbc0fbfd3b1efb21b69a713ef
Closes-Bug: #1796068
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to AZAwareWeightScheduler as of Mitaka

AZAwareWeightScheduler is based on WeightScheduler and provides a way to make
DHCP agent scheduling be AZ-aware. This is used in conjunction with
dhcp-agents-per-network config option and per-network agents (such as dnsmasq)
will be distributed across neutron-dhcp-agents that have availability_zone
configuration (based on dhcp-load-type for placement calculation).

bp: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/add-availability-zone

Upgrade impact is mentioned here:
specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/mitaka/availability-zone.html

The spec mentions that by default all agents belong to 'nova' AZ so
the scheduler change should be backwards-compatible.

Change-Id: I4d948efa157573fdbc0fbfd3b1efb21b69a713ef
Closes-Bug: #1796068

subject: Update inaccurate details in JWS specification
messages: [{'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2019-01-18 21:33:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11022, 'date': '2019-01-18 21:36:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2019-01-18 21:46:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11022, 'date': '2019-01-18 22:10:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2019-01-22 16:16:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2\n\nThanks for the pyjwt issues. LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-01-25 11:31:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-18 21:33:42.000000000', 'message': "Update inaccurate details in JWS specification

Originally, when we were designing the implementation for a JWT
provider, we thought we would be able to use multiple signature
support in the JWS specification to allow tokens to have multiple
signatures. This would allow operators to specify multiple private
keys when rotating old/compromised keys off of a keystone server.

While that information is clearly documentedin the JWS specification:

  https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7515#section-7

Support for signing tokens with multiple private keys doesn't exist
yet in the library we're consuming for JWT (PyJWT).

This commit updates the specification with those details and attempts
to preserve the context of why we're not taking a multi-signature
approach right now.

bp json-web-tokens

Change-Id: I3c1d431241fab79d7c3feefeb978a977487e7bc0
"}, {'created': '2019-01-18 21:46:48.000000000', 'message': "Update inaccurate details in JWS specification

Originally, when we were designing the implementation for a JWT
provider, we thought we would be able to use multiple signature
support in the JWS specification to allow tokens to have multiple
signatures. This would allow operators to specify multiple private
keys when rotating old/compromised keys off of a keystone server.

While that information is clearly documentedin the JWS specification:

  https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7515#section-7

Support for signing tokens with multiple private keys doesn't exist
yet in the library we're consuming for JWT (PyJWT).

This commit updates the specification with those details and attempts
to preserve the context of why we're not taking a multi-signature
approach right now. I've opened an issue in the upstream library we
consume to track the discussion:

  https://github.com/jpadilla/pyjwt/issues/390

bp json-web-tokens

Change-Id: I3c1d431241fab79d7c3feefeb978a977487e7bc0
"}]
commit_message:
Update inaccurate details in JWS specification

Originally, when we were designing the implementation for a JWT
provider, we thought we would be able to use multiple signature
support in the JWS specification to allow tokens to have multiple
signatures. This would allow operators to specify multiple private
keys when rotating old/compromised keys off of a keystone server.

While that information is clearly documentedin the JWS specification:

  https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7515#section-7

Support for signing tokens with multiple private keys doesn't exist
yet in the library we're consuming for JWT (PyJWT).

This commit updates the specification with those details and attempts
to preserve the context of why we're not taking a multi-signature
approach right now. I've opened an issue in the upstream library we
consume to track the discussion:

  https://github.com/jpadilla/pyjwt/issues/390

bp json-web-tokens

Change-Id: I3c1d431241fab79d7c3feefeb978a977487e7bc0

subject: Increase gather_facts timeout
messages:
[{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-01-17 20:34:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2019-01-18 09:12:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-18 09:58:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-18 14:56:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Bifrost build log says this:

[WARNING]: Found variable using reserved name: gather_timeout

in http://logs.openstack.org/24/631624/1/check/kolla-build-centos-source/4b0202f/logs/build/bifrost-base.txt.gz'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-01-18 15:26:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

you're right, I think this is the wrong spot. Will look at it today"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-18 15:29:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

You can probably use an environment variable in the command invocation.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-01-18 17:32:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-01-18 19:34:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck percona mirror problems, http://logs.openstack.org/24/631624/2/check/kolla-ansible-centos-source/387854b/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-01-18_17_55_49_927152'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-19 08:07:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-19 08:07:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

We hit the issue at deploy time also, so added the environment to the image.'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2019-01-21 09:17:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

This doesn't seem be taken into account:

        "TimeoutError: Timer expired after 10 seconds", 
        "fatal: [127.0.0.1]: FAILED! => {", 
        "    \"changed\": false, ", 
        "    \"cmd\": \"/usr/sbin/udevadm info --query property --name /dev/xvda1\", ", 
        "    \"invocation\": {", 
        "        \"module_args\": {", 
        "            \"fact_path\": \"/etc/ansible/facts.d\", ", 
        "            \"filter\": \"*\", ", 
        "            \"gather_subset\": [", 
        "                \"all\"", 
        "            ], ", 
        "            \"gather_timeout\": 10", 
        "        }", 
        "    }, ", 
        "    \"msg\": \"Timer expired after 10 seconds\", ", 
        "    \"rc\": 257", 
        "}", 

http://logs.openstack.org/24/631624/3/check/kolla-ansible-bifrost-centos-source/bb2fb2c/primary/logs/ansible/deploy-bifrost

Perhaps the workaround should be better in bifrost itself?'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-21 12:02:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> This doesn't seem be taken into account:
 > 
 > "TimeoutError: Timer expired after 10 seconds",
 > "fatal: [127.0.0.1]: FAILED! => {",
 > "    \"changed\": false, ",
 > "    \"cmd\": \"/usr/sbin/udevadm info --query property --name
 > /dev/xvda1\", ",
 > "    \"invocation\": {",
 > "        \"module_args\": {",
 > "            \"fact_path\": \"/etc/ansible/facts.d\", ",
 > "            \"filter\": \"*\", ",
 > "            \"gather_subset\": [",
 > "                \"all\"",
 > "            ], ",
 > "            \"gather_timeout\": 10",
 > "        }",
 > "    }, ",
 > "    \"msg\": \"Timer expired after 10 seconds\", ",
 > "    \"rc\": 257",
 > "}",
 > 
 > http://logs.openstack.org/24/631624/3/check/kolla-ansible-bifrost-centos-source/bb2fb2c/primary/logs/ansible/deploy-bifrost
 > 
 > Perhaps the workaround should be better in bifrost itself?

I think the problem is that bifrost is executing the setup module directly in some places, and it appears that that is using the module default of 10 seconds.

I built the image locally and it's definitely picking up that config option. On my laptop it times out if I set ANSIBLE_GATHER_TIMEOUT to 1 second. However, if I do this it doesn't time out (using the module default of 10 seconds):

- hosts: localhost
  gather_facts: no
  tasks:
    - setup:'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-21 12:03:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Related: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/17316'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-21 12:42:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-21 12:42:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Proposed a bifrost change to make gathering facts configurable.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-21 15:28:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-21 15:29:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Increase gather_facts timeout

Bifrost containers are failing to build occassionally due to udevadm
timeouts. This is likely related to an ansible issue,
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/43884, which can be worked
around by increasing the gather facts timeout value. This change updates
it to 30 seconds from the default 10.

Change-Id: If252e41a012a24f31cf2f1414657ac18c819228f
Closes-Bug: #1812259
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/632078

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-29 15:08:39.000000000', 'message': "Add RPC query API to l2pop for FDB resync

This commit extends the l2pop rpc handles to allow
an agent to query the full FDB for a list of
network_id values. This is needed by the agents which
want to support l2pop but don't have ports bound to
themself. This can be used by these agents to get a
full FDB snapshot whenever it restarts. This is not
needed by normal layer2 agents. Because the l2pop
mechanism driver is able to detect whenever the first
port comes up on an agent and therefore knows when to
send the full FDB. Since some agent doesn't have ports
bound to it and l2pop mechanism driver won't be
triggered to send this information to it.

Add class L2populationRpcCallBackMixin
Add class L2populationServerQueryAPI
Add method get_fdb_entries and _get_fdb_entries

Change-Id: I4b96fab7fb1bf822cb75c4a11c2d260be7fbb79a
Co-Authored-By: Allain Legacy<Allain.legacy@windriver.com>

commit_message:
Add RPC query API to l2pop for FDB resync

This commit extends the l2pop rpc handles to allow
an agent to query the full FDB for a list of
network_id values. This is needed by the agents which
want to support l2pop but don't have ports bound to
themself. This can be used by these agents to get a
full FDB snapshot whenever it restarts. This is not
needed by normal layer2 agents. Because the l2pop
mechanism driver is able to detect whenever the first
port comes up on an agent and therefore knows when to
send the full FDB. Since some agent doesn't have ports
bound to it and l2pop mechanism driver won't be
triggered to send this information to it.

Add class L2populationRpcCallBackMixin
Add class L2populationServerQueryAPI
Add method get_fdb_entries and _get_fdb_entries

Co-Authored-By: Allain Legacy<Allain.legacy@windriver.com>

Related-Bug: #1806316
Story: #2004575
Change-Id: I4b96fab7fb1bf822cb75c4a11c2d260be7fbb79a

[{'created': '2018-10-17 10:14:33.000000000', 'message': "Add class L3RouterL2PopMixin to add l2pop support for floating ip resources

Add Class L3RouterL2PopMixin to process the event sent after
 updating floating ip. This class should subscribe the event
  and register the callback to l2pop mechanism driver
   to extend the l2pop fdbs(Dependency on RFE:
   https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1793653).
Add Callback l3_fdb_extend_func.
Add function handle_fip_status_update to process
the event and send the l2pop fdbs out. What's more,
some other functions used by the functions described above are added.

Modify L3RouterPlugin to extends  L3RouterL2PopMixin.

Change-Id: I59a7dbd48d986cc2e4147607a9229feb188adc2b

commit_message:
Add class L3RouterL2PopMixin to add l2pop support for floating ip resources

Add Class L3RouterL2PopMixin to process the event sent after
updating floating ip. This class should subscribe the event
and register the callback to l2pop mechanism driver to extend
the l2pop fdbs(Dependency on RFE:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1793653).

Co-Authored-By: Allain Legacy<Allain.legacy@windriver.com>

Related-Bug: #1803494
Story: #2004544
Change-Id: I59a7dbd48d986cc2e4147607a9229feb188adc2b

In the l3_db.py, 'notify' is used in a lot of places. Do I need to change all those codes or just make sure my code use "publish"?'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-12-05 06:01:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28961, 'date': '2018-12-06 09:28:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> (1 comment)

Thank you for your comment! It makes sense to use AFTER_DELETE notification. But the router_id and port_id in AFTER_DELETE notification are None. In such case, the last_known_router_id and last_fixed_port_id should be used to construct FDB entries which are used to remove FDBs on each host. But last_known_router_id and last_fixed_port_id are not included in AFTER_DELETE notification. I will double check this and try to insert last_known_router_id and last_fixed_port_id into AFTER_DELETE notification.'}, {'account_id': 4187, 'date': '2018-12-07 21:39:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Thanks for the response, that helps explain the the thought process behind this. I doubt sending last_known_router_id and last_fixed_port_id is terribly disruptive since this would be an additive change. It should be OK to send those values on an AFTER_DELETE notification. That is valuable information about a floating IP.'}, {'account_id': 28961, 'date': '2018-12-14 09:21:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-12-14 11:01:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Build succeeded.

commit_message:
Modify l3_db.py to send event after updating floating ip

In order to add l2pop support for floating ip resources,
event with floating ip status should be sent out
after updating floating ip.

Add function _notify_fip_status
Modify function _delete_floatingip to use _notify_fip_status
Modify function _update_fip_assoc
Modify function disassociate_floatingips

Co-Authored-By: Allain Legacy<Allain.legacy@windriver.com>

Related-Bug: #1803494
Story: #2004544
Change-Id: Ifced3d2945b3afd5d62b470f65f2534f609115fc

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
[RFE] Enable other subprojects to extend l2pop fdb information

Adding an extension registration mechanism so that other subprojects
can extend the information included in a full FDB messages before
it is sent to the agent.

Add a global variable l2pop_fdb_extend_funcs to store the registered
function by other subprojects.

Add a function register_fdb_extend_func to be used by other subprojects
to register function to l2pop.

Add a function run_fdb_extend_funcs to be called every time full fdbs
are created. Thus the pre-registered functions stored in the global
variable l2pop_fdb_extend_funcs will be called to extend the newly
created fdbs.

Co-Authored-By: Allain Legacy<Allain.legacy@windriver.com>

Closes-Bug: #1793653
Change-Id: I87450e332c1a6d8bd529eb8082292e73c533676e

commit_message:
Set virt queue size as 1024 for all OVS-DPDK roles

In order to achieve better performance, OVS-DPDK instances
should have the virt queue size configured as 1k. This patch
configures the parameter for all the defined OVS-DPDK roles.
Closes-Bug: #1789827

Change-Id: Ib5d97303b973f96af8e3e0806f2549d85860d6f5
(cherry picked from commit 1e723b72f841fa72669cb628e68da61ff8ee3e08)

commit_message:
Set virt queue size as 1024 for all OVS-DPDK roles

In order to achieve better performance, OVS-DPDK instances
should have the virt queue size configured as 1k. This patch
configures the parameter for all the defined OVS-DPDK roles.
Closes-Bug: #1789827

[stable/queens only] Added disable_upgrade_deployment parameter
for the new role ComputeOvsDpdkSriov and ComputeOvsDpdkSriovRT
to align with other role definitions.

Change-Id: Ib5d97303b973f96af8e3e0806f2549d85860d6f5
(cherry picked from commit 1e723b72f841fa72669cb628e68da61ff8ee3e08)
(cherry picked from commit 2bd91308af26c44f6c7409d250a5033bce3538be)

commit_message:
Add NeutronSriovHostConfig mapping to neutron-sriov.yaml file

With docker migration, VFs need to be configured on the host, which
is done by NeutronSriovHostConfig service. This issue has been fixed
in I30d790c917f5bdbf0d6e6fca66aea7d08c1c8d10, which is done before
the baremetal to docker service migration. During the migration,
Ib9fbad05eeb57dc641499fbf411cb5870da7a8e9 has introduced this issue
again of missing the mapping for NeutronSriovHostConfig service in
the SR-IOV environment file. Fix the issue in the stable/queens
branch's SR-IOV environment file.
Closes-Bug: #1789799

Change-Id: Iaedc6162b17154148e361e50197e393cf314693a

I can't figure out why the tests can't catch this, seems the AttributeError is not raised accessing the mock object .status field, and changing the test to do that seems like more work for such an obvious fix."}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-01-17 14:41:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This would actually catch it in the test, I knew there was a way :)

diff --git a/neutron/tests/unit/agent/metadata/test_agent.py b/neutron/tests/unit/agent/metadata/test_agent.py
index 09c6c7f..6566e4b 100644
--- a/neutron/tests/unit/agent/metadata/test_agent.py
+++ b/neutron/tests/unit/agent/metadata/test_agent.py
@@ -334,12 +334,17 @@ class _TestMetadataProxyHandlerCacheMixin(object):
         )
 
     def _proxy_request_test_helper(self, response_code=200, method='GET'):
+        class S(object):
+            def __str__(self):
+                raise AttributeError
+
         hdrs = {'X-Forwarded-For': '8.8.8.8'}
         body = 'body'
 
         req = mock.Mock(path_info='/the_path', query_string='', headers=hdrs,
                         method=method, body=body)
         resp = mock.MagicMock(status_code=response_code)
+        resp.status = S()
         resp.content = 'content'
         req.response = resp
         with mock.patch.object(self.handler, '_sign_instance_id') as sign:"}, {'account_id': 25618, 'date': '2019-01-18 06:31:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25618, 'date': '2019-01-18 06:32:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Use status_code instead of status in requests

It fixes raising exception for response with not recognized
status code.

Co-Authored-By: Brian Haley <haleyb.dev@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I174ff62cb6599e4c7bdc86cb2d0786f9f2499b00
Related-Bug: 1790598

The L3AgentExtension class delete_router() method expects a
dict as it's 'data' argument, but the l3-agent code that
deletes a router was passing just the router ID.  Change to
correctly pass a router dictionary that at a minimum

commit_message:
Fix l3-agent usage of L3AgentExtension class

The L3AgentExtension class delete_router() method expects a
dict as it's 'data' argument, but the l3-agent code that
deletes a router was passing just the router ID.  Change to
correctly pass a router dictionary if one exists.

Change-Id: I112d1f8dce9defddfbd8fbfa75bf538e308e1561
Closes-bug: #1809134

One more thing. I think that it would be good to add fullstack test to cover such case.
In fullstack You can add test which will:

1. spawn vm and configure QoS on it,
2. Stop L2 agent,
3. remove qos rule from policy,
4. start L2 agent
5. check if rules are cleared properly,

Please check https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/tests/fullstack/test_qos.py for details how QoS fullstack tests are done.'}, {'account_id': 25643, 'date': '2019-01-07 16:30:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-01-07 18:10:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

commit_message:
Clear residual qos rules after l2-agent restarts.

During the l2-agent stop, if the policy rule is cleared,
after the l2-agent is started, the qos rule that has been applied should be cleared.

Change-Id: Iaaff10dfa8ac6ab8c9dead3124e2bb3caa03a665
Closes-Bug: #1810025

commit_message:
Gracefully handle fetch network fail in qos extend port

When the qos plugin is handling a port resource request through it's
port resource request extension, sometimes the network a port is
attached to is looked up and returns None. It may happen like that
if network will be deleted in concurrent API request.

Change-Id: Ide4acdf4c373713968f9d43274fb0c7550283c11
Closes-Bug: #1810504

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-08 09:54:18.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to using systemd units for radosgw

Switch to using systemd configurations to manage radosgw instances;
the radosgw init script is obsolete and will be removed at some
point in time, and the newer style of managing radosgw daemons is
inline with current best-practice.

This changeset also changes the way cephx keys are issues; before
all rgw instances shared a key, now a key is issued per host.

Existing deployments using the radosgw init script will be switched
to use the new systemd named units; this occurs once the new key
for the unit has been presented by the ceph-mon cluster over the
mon relation. A small period of outage will occur as the radosgw
init based daemon is stopped and disabled prior to the start of
the new systemd based radosgw unit.

Change-Id: Ic0d634e619185931633712cb3e3685051a28749d
Closes-Bug: 1808140

Switch to using systemd configurations to manage radosgw instances;

inline with current best-practice.

This changeset also changes the way cephx keys are issues; before

The key is named 'rgw.`hostname`' to identify the application

to use the new systemd named units; this occurs once the new key
for the unit has been presented by the ceph-mon cluster over the
mon relation. A small period of outage will occur as the radosgw
init based daemon is stopped and disabled prior to the start of

commit_message:
Switch to using systemd units for radosgw

Switch to using systemd configurations to manage radosgw instances;
the radosgw init script is obsolete and will be removed at some
point in time, and the newer style of managing radosgw daemons is
inline with current best-practice.

This changeset also changes the way cephx keys are issues; before
all rgw instances shared a key, now a key is issued per host.

The key is named 'rgw.`hostname`' to identify the application
and host using the key.

Existing deployments using the radosgw init script will be switched
to use the new systemd named units; this occurs once the new key
for the unit has been presented by the ceph-mon cluster over the
mon relation. A small period of outage will occur as the radosgw
init based daemon is stopped and disabled prior to the start of
the new systemd based radosgw unit.

This commit also includes a resync for charmhelpers to pickup
support for '@' in NRPE service check names.

Change-Id: Ic0d634e619185931633712cb3e3685051a28749d
Depends-On: I289b75a2935184817b424c5eceead16235c3f53b
Closes-Bug: 1808140

commit_message:
Remove the scenario standalones from tht zuul layout - just use template

In I7cf36baa80e91d87b1b41c45204c61cf87846d34 we started using the
tripleo-standalone-scenarios-full instead of carrying custom
layout for the standalone jobs in projects. Looks like we forgot
to remove the gate definitions here.

Change-Id: I2c3940c7903f9fd4b9d0ec1aca8741182b9c76cd

commit_message:
Add volume group list/show support for admin panel

This commit allows admin to list /show cinder volume groups
using horizon dashboard.

TODO:
1. Modify/Delete volume groups

Partially-Implements blueprint cinder-generic-volume-groups

Change-Id: I75d463204cf83492b30523f46dd0507bbb86dd2e

commit_message:
Convert policy.json into policy-in-code

This commit converts the existing neutron-fwaas policy.json
into policy-in-code.

policy.json for testing is also removed. As a result, setup_config()
in neutron_fwaas.tests.base.NeutronDbPluginV2TestCase is no longer
required now (as the content of setup_config() is now same as that
in neutron).

Partially Implements: blueprint neutron-policy-in-code
Change-Id: I67be3a21f19e3f793312d64d358452ee4531c080

commit_message:
Change DVR to use ip_lib.add_ip_address() directly

The DVR Edge router code creates an IPDevice() object just
to make a single call to add an IP address.  Change it to
call ip_lib.add_ip_address() directly instead since that's
what's being done in the IpAddrCommand.add() code anways.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: Ie7640fc54494de89e85b2f528bddc79875a16046

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-15 12:01:04.000000000', 'message': "Remove IPv6 addresses in dnsmasq leases file

IPv6 address format in dnsmasq leases file is incorrect (correct format
is described in bug description). This bad formatting generates the
following error when initializing dnsmasq:
  dnsmasq[20603]: failed to parse lease database, invalid line: \
    1547121093 fa:16:3e:a0:3a:9a [fd5b:1fd5:8295:5339::43] * ...

This patch removes the IPv6 addresses from the leases file, as proposed
in the bug, because the DHCP agent does not have the IAID (identity
association identifier) of each IPv6 address assigned.

In case of agent restart, dnsmasq won't have any IPv6 address in the
leases file, but the hosts file and the additional hosts file will
contain all MAC/IPv6 previous assignations. When the IPv6 client sends
a DHCPDISCOVER, dnsmasq will offer the same IPv6 address to this client.
At the same time, the client will request to the server the same address:
  DHCPDISCOVER(tap2c14823a-e6) fa:16:3e:54:c6:8e
  DHCPOFFER(tap2c14823a-e6) fd5b:1fd5:8295:5339::43 fa:16:3e:54:c6:8e
  DHCPREQUEST(tap2c14823a-e6) fd5b:1fd5:8295:5339::43 fa:16:3e:54:c6:8e
  DHCPACK(tap2c14823a-e6) fd5b:1fd5:8295:5339::43 fa:16:3e:54:c6:8e \
    host-fd5b-1fd5-8295-5339--43

Once dnsmasq updates the leases database, rewrites the leases file with the
new IPv6 address (including the IAID) and the server DUID (if not present).

Change-Id: Ib1b2f284ab81f1c4af7b08b5257b45a3f6e79c3e
Closes-Bug: #1722126

commit_message:
Remove IPv6 addresses in dnsmasq leases file

IPv6 address format in dnsmasq leases file is incorrect (correct format
is described in bug description). This bad formatting generates the
following error when initializing dnsmasq:
  dnsmasq[20603]: failed to parse lease database, invalid line: \
    1547121093 fa:16:3e:a0:3a:9a [fd5b:1fd5:8295:5339::43] * ...

This patch removes the IPv6 addresses from the leases file, as proposed
in the bug, because the DHCP agent does not have the IAID (identity
association identifier) of each IPv6 address assigned.

In case of agent restart, dnsmasq won't have any IPv6 address in the
leases file, but the hosts file and the additional hosts file will
contain all MAC/IPv6 previous assignations. When the IPv6 client sends
a DHCPDISCOVER, dnsmasq will offer the same IPv6 address to this client.
At the same time, the client will request to the server the same address:
  DHCPDISCOVER(tap2c14823a-e6) fa:16:3e:54:c6:8e
  DHCPOFFER(tap2c14823a-e6) fd5b:1fd5:8295:5339::43 fa:16:3e:54:c6:8e
  DHCPREQUEST(tap2c14823a-e6) fd5b:1fd5:8295:5339::43 fa:16:3e:54:c6:8e
  DHCPACK(tap2c14823a-e6) fd5b:1fd5:8295:5339::43 fa:16:3e:54:c6:8e \
    host-fd5b-1fd5-8295-5339--43

Once dnsmasq updates the leases database, rewrites the leases file with the
new IPv6 address (including the IAID) and the server DUID (if not present).

Change-Id: Ib1b2f284ab81f1c4af7b08b5257b45a3f6e79c3e
Closes-Bug: #1722126

commit_message:
Use template for lower-constraints

Small cleanups:

* Use openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template, remove individual
  jobs.
* Sort list of templates

Also, raise some lower-constraints since oslo.policy and
python-glanceclient requires a newer version.

Change-Id: I0304207ba4b8acc6a53da1f547b806bac8a917e6
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/623229
